newsitem.title: USA: MOTOR RACING-DAYTONA INTERNATIONAL SPEEDWAY TO INSTALL LIGHTS.
newsitem.headline: MOTOR RACING-DAYTONA INTERNATIONAL SPEEDWAY TO INSTALL LIGHTS.

text.p: The Daytona International Speedway will have stadium lights by next year's July 4 running of the Pepsi 400 in what officials said Friday will be one of the world's largest outdoor lighting projects.
Construction on the multi-million dollar project will begin shortly after Saturday's Winston Cup race and will require at least 2,200 fixtures on 130 poles across the 2.5 mile (4 km) oval.
Over 150 miles (240 km) of wire and 800 tons (725,760 kg) of concrete will be used.
"This will be the benchmark by what other major projects will be judged," said Daytona International Speedway President John Graham.
Daytona International Speedway is also currently expanding its seating capacity by 18,000 seats to 140,000 for next year's race.
